Tesla recorded remarkable revenue growth in the energy segment in fiscal year 2024, significantly outpacing its automotive segment, as shown in the chart above. From fiscal years 2022 to 2024, Tesla’s energy segment generated an impressive average annual revenue growth rate of 54%, compared to 22% from the automotive sector. Overall, Tesla’s strategic focus on diversifying its revenue streams and reducing reliance on the automotive segment has contributed to the accelerated growth of the energy segment. https://www.investopedia.com/tesla-s-lar.content: Tesla electric car sales make up the biggest share of revenue Tesla Inc. Tesla's automotive segment accounts for the vast majority of its revenue and profits at the Austin-headquartered company. Tesla faces growing competition from other major automakers who are developing and marketing electric vehicles including General Motors Co. Tesla's automotive segment includes the design, development, manufacturing, sales, and leasing of electric vehicles as well as the sale of automotive regulatory credits. Tesla also faces a second probe from the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration after reports of "phantom braking" of the company's vehicles at high speeds. Tesla is best known for manufacturing, selling, and servicing all-electric vehicles in major hubs all over the world. Tesla Inc. Tesla.
